oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Discharge paper for Pvt. William Fields
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Co. K, 5th Tenn. Mtd. Inf, USA. Fields was a 20-year-old farmer, 5'10" inches tall, with a dark complexion, dark eyes and dark hair when he enlisted in the Federal army in Cleveland, Tennessee on Nov. 27, 1864. He mustered in Feb. 1, 1865 in Nashville, was promoted to corporal, then deserted in March 1865. Demoted to private, he returned to duty and worked as a teamster. When he mustered out July 12, 1865, the record noted that he was due $161 in pay, and had lost his bayonet and gun sling.
